Hey all, I’m getting started in my coding career and have just grasped the front-end languages. I’d like to next conquer Hubl and have read that it is similar to PHP and also Python. Does anyone have any recommendations for what background would be good before learning Hubl?

When i started with Hubl, I don’’t know any programming language so i just give my self a challenge. hubl is really easy to get started with…

I suggest to start <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl|from here> and once you become comfortable with syntax then go to next steps like <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters|hubl filters>, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags|hubl tags> etc. :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm using a boolean (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#boolean>) with `export_to_template_context=true`. Is there a parameter available to change "Value" to say something else?

You can change the label and the true/false default value but that’s it.

I would recommend using a custom module instead. Even if right now you only need one field it allows for a lot more flexibility and customization than tags do.

Yeah this is a quick fix for now until I decide what to do long term. I need to be able to hide/show T&Cs, and ideally it would be based on whether a module I have created has items created in it, but I haven't found a way to do that as it seems anything within that module is only accessible in the module.
I guess I would need further context to really give a useful suggestion. Module data is available within the page context, module JavaScript also can also operate on any HTML in a page.

This is all for email templates, that show price tiles from a custom local module. User can choose if and how many price tiles to include in the email in the UI. If no price tiles exist, I don't want to show the T&Cs further down in the email (outside the module).
make sure you have a test portal and don’t be afraid to break stuff! To me, HubL is easier than javascript, so if you have that frontend language down then I think you’re golden. GLHF

Ahh, I see.

And doing 1 module that uses a repeatable group which houses the what is currently the price tile module. Then displaying T&C based on the length of items in the repeater. Is that option out of the question?

The module has a repeatable group, yep. But the T&C's aren't inside the module, they're at the bottom of the email with the legal stuff.

So, I would like to be able to wrap the T&Cs in an if statement, but I can't figure out what the syntax is to determine the length of the items from the repeater in the module. I can use `{% if module.custom_module_name|length >= 1 %` within the module, but it doesn't work outside of it.

I wish I had a better solution for you. I can’t guarantee this will actually work. So I recommend testing beforehand.

`{{content.widgets|pprint}}`  That should return all of the modules in the email and their contents.
Oh my gosh thank YOU!!! That helped me see the structure. I have 2 price tiles in the email, and using `content.widgets.custom_module_name.body.group_name|length` returns a 2! :smile:
